title: Prepare To Be Scared At Vampire Pleasure Beach!
text:
Ghastly screams and fright night thrills await you at Vampire Pleasure Beach this Halloween!
Get ready for the fright of your life as Blackpool Pleasure Beach turns blood red on October 31 as creatures of the night make the 42-acre attraction their home.
A frightening theme will run throughout the attraction with a Horror Maze open, pumpkins appearing across the park and spooky music throughout. It’s set to be a “Thriller!”. Watch out for the hoards of the undead who will be roaming the park!
Guests can take on white-knuckle rides like the Big One, the UK’s tallest roller coaster, spin their senses on Infusion and explore the fiery fantasy landscape of the Vikings in one of the world’s biggest dark rides, Valhalla. For the little monsters there are the thrills and spills of 12 amazing rides in Nickelodeon Land to enjoy.
X Factor finalists Sam Callahan and Jack Walton and Britain’s Got Talent winner, Jai McDowall are just a few of the great acts that will be playing on the Fright Night stage. Joining them will be up and coming band The Moon Kids, Exposure and Henry Gallagher plus many many more.
All guests arriving in Halloween costume will receive a free blood-red slush upon arrival at the attraction and the chance to win a Platinum Pass for the 2016 season when they enter the Halloween Fancy Dress competition, judged by Blackpool Pleasure Beach Managing Director, Amanda Thompson OBE. Under 12s need to head to the Fright Night Stage at 5.30pm for a chance to win, while over 12s should head to the Fright Night Stage at 5.45pm for their chance to win.
There’s also a triple treat in store with a Pleasure Beach wristband, a ticket to the horrors of Pasaje del Terror and a seat at The Circus of Horrors at The Globe on October 31st for just £35 when booked online in advance at www.vampirepleasurebeach.com
Vampire Pleasure Beach wristbands are available from 4pm and can be booked online for £20 in advance or £22 on the gate. Blackpool Pleasure Beach will be open until 10pm; guests who already have a wristband for the day are welcome to enjoy the rest of the events taking place this Halloween.
Editor’s notes
Vampire Pleasure Beach will commence from 4pm till 10pm on October 31. All wristbands are £20 when booked online in advance and £22 on the gate when purchased from 4pm. Those guests who are already on park can enjoy Vampire Pleasure Beach at no extra cost.
The Triple Treat Package for Vampire Pleasure Beach is also available including entrance to Pasaje del Terror, a Pleasure Beach Wristband and a seat at The Circus of Horrors at The Globe for just £35.
For more information on any of the above deals contact 0871 222 1234 or visit www.blackpoolpleasurebeach.com
